text:
Yup, Alan Kay definitely would agree that a bicycle for the mind must expand minds. Consider this passage:

_"..when television came on the scene, some of its inventors thought it would be a way of getting Shakespeare to the masses. But they forgot that you have to be more sophisticated and have more perspective to understand Shakespeare. What television was able to do was to capture people as they were."_ [implying that that's sub-optimal]
(<https://queue.acm.org/detail.cfm?id=1039523>)

attachments.title: A Conversation with Alan Kay - ACM Queue
attachments.text: When you want to gain a historical perspective on personal computing and programming languages, why not turn to one of the industry
